commit_message:
docs: Update help text for encryption provider

The volume encryption provider no longer uses class names.
Instead, 'luks' and 'plain' are used. This patch updates
the help text for the volume encryption provider to use
the new encryption provider format constants.

Change-Id: I582b239d9de86aa1f1f5e55d4576cc65d33e74a7

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ie7869e723f56fe6b8af1b3b90704d1982412e28d

an implementation in SDK.

Depends-On: Ifaef01ec5f348b7bd7466ec6c662a204d78af2d3
Change-Id: I3dc6e0b08908e07d5071ffede7be6db29d38bdcf

commit_message:
Add alias for zaqar messaging service

Just confirmed with Zaqar team that the official service name for Zaqar
is 'messaging'. When trying to identify services supported by SDK, we
need to know that 'messaging' is the same thing as 'message' which has
an implementation in SDK.

Depends-On: Ifaef01ec5f348b7bd7466ec6c662a204d78af2d3
Change-Id: I3dc6e0b08908e07d5071ffede7be6db29d38bdcf
Closes-Bug: #1747904

When containerizing mistral-executor, we need to mount /var/lib/mistral so

commit_message:
mistral-executor: mount /var/lib/mistral

When containerizing mistral-executor, we need to mount /var/lib/mistral so
our operators can get the config-download logs when the undercloud is
containerized and config-download is used to deploy the overcloud.

To help our operators, we also create /var/lib/mistral/readme.txt so
they know where to find the config-download data.

Change-Id: I8d31d5fec2721c6e4f82b1ad2169a7635cb57600
Closes-Bug: #1749823

commit_message:
Stop running non-voting jobs in gate

There isn't a need to run non-voting jobs in gate, as it ends up just
wasting CI resources.  Results can be obtained from the check pipeline
results.

Change-Id: Id24b1c6b5f3f8c26e4bbbf155f196029bed4141e
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix the freezer-agent.log path for doc

the freezer-agent service's log is 
/var/log/freezer-agent/freezer-agent.log [0] or ~/.freezer/freezer.log
[1], rather than /var/log/freezer.log

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/freezer/blob/master/freezer/common/config.py#L582
[1]: https://github.com/openstack/freezer/blob/master/freezer/common/config.py#L589

Change-Id: I21c5dba4c551646a6f997d28257dab12de0ed973

commit_message:
Restart only when needed

The role currently always restarts Magnum at the end
of every run which is not ideal.

This patch removes the restart at every run and adds
a notify for configuration changes.

Change-Id: Ia47d9983598598b5550d623df78aae616d8948a4

subject: Don't load nested stack to get ResourceGroup blacklist
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-16 15:10:05.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/software_deployment.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/resource_group.py', 'heat/tests/openstack/heat/test_resource_group.py'], 'message': "Don't load nested stack to get ResourceGroup blacklist

In ResourceGroup, we (unwisely in retrospect) allow blacklisting of
resources by reference ID (i.e. physical resource ID in most cases). In
order to both determine whether a removal policy entry was an existing
resource name and (if not) to find the resource by physical ID, we would
always load the nested stack into memory.

To avoid this, unconditionally create an output in the nested stack that
returns a mapping of all the resource reference IDs and use it for finding
a resource with a matching reference ID. Only if the output is not
available (because the nested stack hasn't been updated since prior to the
output being defined), fall back to the old way of doing it.

Avoid looking up IDs for names that already appear in the blacklist
(because they were blacklisted in a previous update and have been removed
from the stack.)

Since this is more expensive in time (though hopefully cheaper in space),
update the blacklist only once on resource creation and whenever it
actually changes during an update. This is accomplished by moving the
update to a separate function that is called explicitly, rather than making
it a side-effect of getting the current blacklist (which occurs up to 4
times in each create/update).

This also avoids updating the blacklist during a preview, which the
previous code erroneously did.

Change-Id: Ic32d7d99bad06f92b3d2919d58cd1f9128bcfe83
Partial-Bug: #1731349
Closes-Bug: #1749426
(cherry picked from commit 32ec5141de1a8017ccfddc5dccf114deff8271ba)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't load nested stack to get ResourceGroup blacklist

In ResourceGroup, we (unwisely in retrospect) allow blacklisting of
resources by reference ID (i.e. physical resource ID in most cases). In
order to both determine whether a removal policy entry was an existing
resource name and (if not) to find the resource by physical ID, we would
always load the nested stack into memory.

To avoid this, unconditionally create an output in the nested stack that
returns a mapping of all the resource reference IDs and use it for finding
a resource with a matching reference ID. Only if the output is not
available (because the nested stack hasn't been updated since prior to the
output being defined), fall back to the old way of doing it.

Avoid looking up IDs for names that already appear in the blacklist
(because they were blacklisted in a previous update and have been removed
from the stack.)

Since this is more expensive in time (though hopefully cheaper in space),
update the blacklist only once on resource creation and whenever it
actually changes during an update. This is accomplished by moving the
update to a separate function that is called explicitly, rather than making
it a side-effect of getting the current blacklist (which occurs up to 4
times in each create/update).

This also avoids updating the blacklist during a preview, which the
previous code erroneously did.

Change-Id: Ic32d7d99bad06f92b3d2919d58cd1f9128bcfe83
Partial-Bug: #1731349
Closes-Bug: #1749426
(cherry picked from commit 32ec5141de1a8017ccfddc5dccf114deff8271ba)

subject: Don't add required attribute to html form fields
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-16 19:09:55.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_auth/forms.py'], 'message': 'Don't add required attribute to html form fields

In Django 1.10 a new Form property was introduced, defaulting to True,
which enabled HTML form validation for fields marked "required" in
Django. This changed old behavior, which was that required fields were
only validated server-side. This patch restores old behavior by setting
use_required_attribute to False for the inherited AuthenticationForm.

This problem arose because when WebSSO is enabled and a
non-keystone-credentials authentication method is selected from the
dropdown list, the now-hidden username and password fields are still
marked "required" and still validated client-side, even though they are
invisible to the user and cannot be filled in. It would be nice to fix
the javascript to properly turn the "required" attribute on or off
depending on what authentication method is selected and whether the
"required" fields are even visible, but for now this just restores the
behavior we had before Djanto 1.10.

Change-Id: I3e798a2288d9c33396b40a86b07ea8c163d3b525
Closes-bug: #1703109
(cherry picked from commit 1fa9ae26cc6006f8ee94fabddb7fea171adee55d)
'}]
commit_message:
Don't add required attribute to html form fields

In Django 1.10 a new Form property was introduced, defaulting to True,
which enabled HTML form validation for fields marked "required" in
Django. This changed old behavior, which was that required fields were
only validated server-side. This patch restores old behavior by setting
use_required_attribute to False for the inherited AuthenticationForm.

This problem arose because when WebSSO is enabled and a
non-keystone-credentials authentication method is selected from the
dropdown list, the now-hidden username and password fields are still
marked "required" and still validated client-side, even though they are
invisible to the user and cannot be filled in. It would be nice to fix
the javascript to properly turn the "required" attribute on or off
depending on what authentication method is selected and whether the
"required" fields are even visible, but for now this just restores the
behavior we had before Djanto 1.10.

Change-Id: I3e798a2288d9c33396b40a86b07ea8c163d3b525
Closes-bug: #1703109
(cherry picked from commit 1fa9ae26cc6006f8ee94fabddb7fea171adee55d)

commit_message:
Update the Tempest plugin to point towards the new plugin

The Magnum service has split it's tests for Tempest in a seperate
repo so this patch updates it.

This patch also fixes the lint issue to use the systemd module
reload feature instead of a command.

Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>
Closes-Bug: #1747607
Depends-On: I5f1ecb71c6125c29d6487bef6c2be215c1b561c1

subject: Install only the required storage driver extras
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-16 14:14:43.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Install only the required storage driver extras

At the moment, all drivers are being installed for Gnocchi even
if some of them are not used.  This also means that some libraries
are being built which are not needed (such as for Ceph or Swift
when using file storage).

This patch switches the behaviour to install only the extra for
the driver in use.

Change-Id: I6e9f938885036d2fabc81094e01e220b09e462dd
(cherry picked from commit 0e5cedca606eb3f365a516078021403070b42c2c)
'}]
commit_message:
Install only the required storage driver extras

At the moment, all drivers are being installed for Gnocchi even
if some of them are not used.  This also means that some libraries
are being built which are not needed (such as for Ceph or Swift
when using file storage).

This patch switches the behaviour to install only the extra for
the driver in use.

Change-Id: I6e9f938885036d2fabc81094e01e220b09e462dd
(cherry picked from commit 0e5cedca606eb3f365a516078021403070b42c2c)

commit_message:
Images: Move default to LOCI and Kolla newton gate

This PS moves the default image in OSH for most services to use LOCI
and also provides a Kolla gate for newton openstack.

Change-Id: Ice6cb9f89bc3ce6e8280e580d215aedda9e71904

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
Point to Queens instead of master

There are references that are pointing to master in each role.
This should change them.

To prevent having a larger patch that includes the removal
of CloudWatch, this commit just ensure cloudwatch isn't tested
during the heat functional test.

Change-Id: I7f0408fe6ccf6da45b6011921623d787e10289e5

subject: Fix for lookup and get_url occuring in different places
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-02-16 18:59:14.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/install.yml'], 'message': "Fix for lookup and get_url occuring in different places

We use an SSH bastion host which we do our deployment through. The
deployment host doesn't have direct access to the same network as the
host. As a result the venv local checksum lookup fails.

I have described this here:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1689283

This is a simple fix for this problem, assuming everything is good it
will need repeating in multiple places in the code base.

Change-Id: I7407c65f5b3322a34905f529f1adc7cac343357e
(cherry picked from commit cd8659007850b075be9628816f567c27f0e256e7)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix for lookup and get_url occuring in different places

We use an SSH bastion host which we do our deployment through. The
deployment host doesn't have direct access to the same network as the
host. As a result the venv local checksum lookup fails.

I have described this here:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1689283

This is a simple fix for this problem, assuming everything is good it
will need repeating in multiple places in the code base.

Change-Id: I7407c65f5b3322a34905f529f1adc7cac343357e
(cherry picked from commit cd8659007850b075be9628816f567c27f0e256e7)

subject: Handle liberty-era neutron
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-02-15 22:45:25.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/config/cloud_region.py', 'openstack/cloud/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': "Handle liberty-era neutron

We had a workaround for this in the shade code, but it really should
have been in the CloudRegion code.

The underlying issue here is that neutron didn't have a version
discovery document, and also that neutronclient just hard-coded an
append of v2.0 to the end of the endpoint in the catalog. There's really
no way around also doing an append - but we can do our best to not do
the append unless we need to.

This is why we can't have nice things.

Change-Id: Ib13826b7cee65f9b08920af8e2d66622db639b44
"}]
commit_message:
Handle liberty-era neutron

We had a workaround for this in the shade code, but it really should
have been in the CloudRegion code.

The underlying issue here is that neutron didn't have a version
discovery document, and also that neutronclient just hard-coded an
append of v2.0 to the end of the endpoint in the catalog. There's really
no way around also doing an append - but we can do our best to not do
the append unless we need to.

This is why we can't have nice things.

Change-Id: Ib13826b7cee65f9b08920af8e2d66622db639b44

subject: Work around discovery being a bit messy for cinder
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-16 00:22:27.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/config/cloud_region.py'], 'message': 'Work around discovery being a bit messy for cinder

Discovery for block-storage is tricky due to project_ids being needed in
the URL still, but the unversioned endpoint in the catalog having no
project_id. Nobody is actually using block-storage yet, so hack it for
the moment until we can figure out a proper solution.

Change-Id: I46d1a88393f70b82075ff3a2f1535c217a8d0a79
'}]
commit_message:
Work around discovery being a bit messy for cinder

Discovery for block-storage is tricky due to project_ids being needed in
the URL still, but the unversioned endpoint in the catalog having no
project_id. Nobody is actually using block-storage yet, so hack it for
the moment until we can figure out a proper solution.

Change-Id: I46d1a88393f70b82075ff3a2f1535c217a8d0a79

subject: Only show errors when copying logs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-16 14:31:26.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/playbooks/post.yml'], 'message': 'Only show errors when copying logs

When copying the logs, the log shows all the files copied
which is unnecessary and just consumes console log space.

In this patch we do not show all the files copied, but we
still show errors which is informative enough  without
wasting log lines.

Change-Id: Iffe4baad65d1d2a1812e62f78d54441ae8dbaff2
'}]
commit_message:
Only show errors when copying logs

When copying the logs, the log shows all the files copied
which is unnecessary and just consumes console log space.

In this patch we do not show all the files copied, but we
still show errors which is informative enough  without
wasting log lines.

Change-Id: Iffe4baad65d1d2a1812e62f78d54441ae8dbaff2

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-16 14:56:15.000000000', 'files': ['placement-api-ref/source/aggregates.inc'], 'message': 'api-ref: Further clarify placement aggregates

Following up on the comments at [1], provide further disambiguation and
clarity on the difference between placement aggregates and nova host
aggregates, with some illustrative examples that include where the
former may be used to represent the latter (as is being proposed via
[2]).

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539033/1/placement-api-ref/source/aggregates.inc@14
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/q/bp/placement-mirror-host-aggregates

Change-Id: I53588fca311992f885c4157591232a864b6a86b1
'}]
commit_message:
api-ref: Further clarify placement aggregates

Following up on the comments at [1], provide further disambiguation and
clarity on the difference between placement aggregates and nova host
aggregates, with some illustrative examples that include where the
former may be used to represent the latter (as is being proposed via
[2]).

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539033/1/placement-api-ref/source/aggregates.inc@14
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/q/bp/placement-mirror-host-aggregates

Change-Id: I53588fca311992f885c4157591232a864b6a86b1

Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

"Tenant" notion is an old keystone v2 thing that has been replaced for a

commit_message:
reproducer: use OS_PROJECT_NAME instead of deprecated OS_TENANT_NAME

"Tenant" notion is an old keystone v2 thing that has been replaced for a
while by "Project", we should use OS_PROJECT_NAME instead of
OS_TENANT_NAME.

OS_PROJECT_NAME works fine with keystone v2 AND keystone v3.

Change-Id: I5e270a36f8b0a823a7752f7fada2fbcd8cc8afdc

subject: Set post-timeout value to half an hour on base jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-16 22:02:53.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/jobs.yaml'], 'message': "Set post-timeout value to half an hour on base jobs

Jobs now have two timeout values. A regular timeout for the bulk of the
job then a timeout for post run playbooks. Set the post run playbook
timeout to half an hour which should be plenty for any post run playbook
by default.

If this isn't sufficient because jobs are uploading large artifacts they
can increase their timeout in their jobs explicitly.

Change-Id: I2a9b67d6d1fbc3b1b8d44140e13351241ca31143
"}]
commit_message:
Set post-timeout value to half an hour on base jobs

Jobs now have two timeout values. A regular timeout for the bulk of the
job then a timeout for post run playbooks. Set the post run playbook
timeout to half an hour which should be plenty for any post run playbook
by default.

If this isn't sufficient because jobs are uploading large artifacts they
can increase their timeout in their jobs explicitly.

Change-Id: I2a9b67d6d1fbc3b1b8d44140e13351241ca31143

This integrates Initiator (one way) CHAP authentication functionality into the
VMAX backend. Prior discovery should have been established. When an initiator
tries to manually connect to the array that is CHAP enabled,
use_chap_auth=True, chap_username and chap_password must be set in the
backend configuration

Change-Id: I037ae494eeb234fe2285b3635d24ee8c5226b9bc
Implements: blueprint vmax-iscsi-chap-authentication
'}]
commit_message:
VMAX driver - Enable CHAP authentication for vmax backend

This integrates Initiator (one way) CHAP authentication functionality into the
VMAX backend. Prior discovery should have been established. When an initiator
tries to manually connect to the array that is CHAP enabled,
use_chap_auth=True, chap_username and chap_password must be set in the
backend configuration

Change-Id: I037ae494eeb234fe2285b3635d24ee8c5226b9bc
Implements: blueprint vmax-iscsi-chap-authentication

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-16 14:30:59.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/playbooks/post.yml'], 'message': 'Only show errors when copying logs

When copying the logs, the log shows all the files copied

Change-Id: Iffe4baad65d1d2a1812e62f78d54441ae8dbaff2

commit_message:
Only show errors when copying logs

When copying the logs, the log shows all the files copied
which is unnecessary and just consumes console log space.

In this patch we do not show all the files copied, but we
still show errors which is informative enough  without
wasting log lines.

Change-Id: Iffe4baad65d1d2a1812e62f78d54441ae8dbaff2

subject: Override root object count with actual listing length when possible
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-02-16 16:52:10.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_container.py', 'test/probe/test_sharder.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/container.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/base.py'], 'message': "Override root object count with actual listing length when possible

When constructing a container listing from shards' listings, the
actual listing length may different from the root container's object
count if shard containers have not updated the root stats.

Before, the X-Container-Object-Count returned to the client was always
the value returned by the root container. With this patch that value
is overridden *when appropriate* by the actual listing length.  This
is only appropriate when the listing is unconstrained (no marker etc.)
and does not get capped by the listng length limit.  In practice this
will only apply to shrinking sharded containers, but also to test
conditions where this patch should make listing results more
predictable.

Change-Id: Ia91fbeefde37ea64bf50220636522f3dc64a6728
"}]
commit_message:
Override root object count with actual listing length when possible

When constructing a container listing from shards' listings, the
actual listing length may different from the root container's object
count if shard containers have not updated the root stats.

Before, the X-Container-Object-Count returned to the client was always
the value returned by the root container. With this patch that value
is overridden *when appropriate* by the actual listing length.  This
is only appropriate when the listing is unconstrained (no marker etc.)
and does not get capped by the listng length limit.  In practice this
will only apply to shrinking sharded containers, but also to test
conditions where this patch should make listing results more
predictable.

Change-Id: Ia91fbeefde37ea64bf50220636522f3dc64a6728

Use option key_manager.backend instead.

it's because nova use castellan and castellan uses

commit_message:
Fix warn api_class is deprecated, use backend

See a warning like
 Config option key_manager.api_class is deprecated.
Use option key_manager.backend instead.

it's because nova use castellan and castellan uses
https://github.com/openstack/castellan/blob/master/castellan/key_manager/__init__.py#L25

so nova need to follow the change to avoid the warning.

Change-Id: Ibfdb087e6421d55ceefd805f67550e668c86be61

retry after calling scheduling function in conductor, this patch

Change-Id: I67b3650564503061480b439d6265a3b4f45ac16c
Closes-Bug: 1738876

commit_message:
Only log during pop retry phase

Retry filter reports confusing log 'Re-scheduling is disabled'
now even if the retry attempts > 0 , this is because we populate
retry after calling scheduling function in conductor, this patch
only log the info when needed in populate function.

Change-Id: I67b3650564503061480b439d6265a3b4f45ac16c
Closes-Bug: 1738876

subject: Add Hadoop 2.8.2 native libs to common artifacts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-16 18:00:23.000000000', 'files': ['common-artifacts/hadoop-native-libs-2.8.2.tar.gz'], 'message': 'Add Hadoop 2.8.2 native libs to common artifacts

Without these, users will encounter messages like "Unable to load
native-hadoop library for your platform...", which is no fun at all.

For posterity's sake, you can note that this artifact was built by
following the instructions given in the README of the "hadoop" element
in SIE, with the additional note that newer Linux distros do not
package protobuf 2.5.0 which must be built from source instead.

Change-Id: I51a9343bd5804254e36b4d52334644ac6f3f8cef
'}]
commit_message:
Add Hadoop 2.8.2 native libs to common artifacts

Without these, users will encounter messages like "Unable to load
native-hadoop library for your platform...", which is no fun at all.

For posterity's sake, you can note that this artifact was built by
following the instructions given in the README of the "hadoop" element
in SIE, with the additional note that newer Linux distros do not
package protobuf 2.5.0 which must be built from source instead.

Change-Id: I51a9343bd5804254e36b4d52334644ac6f3f8cef

subject: Cluster driver: Blacklist iSCSI/FC volume drivers
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-02-16 14:29:18.000000000', 'files': ['compute_hyperv/nova/cluster/volumeops.py', 'compute_hyperv/nova/cluster/driver.py', 'compute_hyperv/nova/volumeops.py', 'compute_hyperv/tests/unit/cluster/test_volumeops.py'], 'message': 'Cluster driver: Blacklist iSCSI/FC volume drivers

There are critical known issues related to the cluster driver and
passthrough disks.

When an instance is failed over, the instance attached volumes need
to be accessible on the destination host. This will not happen
transparently for such disks, for which reason the instance may
bounce between a few nodes and then end up in error state,
basically defeating the purpose of the cluster driver.

This change ensures that the Hyper-V Cluster driver rejects
iSCSI/FC Cinder volumes, raising an error that describes possible
alternatives.

Closes-Bug: #1749958

Change-Id: I231b51c648e1349fcb8df4cd818b2d2887a55d69
'}]
commit_message:
Cluster driver: Blacklist iSCSI/FC volume drivers

There are critical known issues related to the cluster driver and
passthrough disks.

When an instance is failed over, the instance attached volumes need
to be accessible on the destination host. This will not happen
transparently for such disks, for which reason the instance may
bounce between a few nodes and then end up in error state,
basically defeating the purpose of the cluster driver.

This change ensures that the Hyper-V Cluster driver rejects
iSCSI/FC Cinder volumes, raising an error that describes possible
alternatives.

Closes-Bug: #1749958

Change-Id: I231b51c648e1349fcb8df4cd818b2d2887a55d69

subject: Improve console install and restart services appropriately
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2018-02-16 15:31:00.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/consoles/nova_console_spice_install.yml', 'tasks/consoles/nova_console_novnc_install.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/nova-novncproxy-restart-55e030f4e7b8654b.yaml'], 'message': "Improve console install and restart services appropriately

The current implementation wipes out the novnc/spice directory
every single time the playbook executes. While it does replace
it afterwards it does not fire a notifier to make the service
restart, resulting in the service failing.

This patch makes the install process idempotent - it will only
wipe out the directory if it does not look the way it is
expected to look. It also fires the notifier to restart services
if the git repo changes.

This should ensure that novnc/spice restart properly on upgrades
and that there are no changes/restarts for the service if the git
SHA or software does not change.

Backport note:
The 'Manage LB' handler notification is removed as it is not
present in ocata.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/540437
Closes-Bug: #1746523
Change-Id: Ic39f884016a6ba0498110267027783001a087a1c
(cherry picked from commit c41103ba702cd6fd85d8e4d4fe86caef81623f44)
"}]
commit_message:
Improve console install and restart services appropriately

The current implementation wipes out the novnc/spice directory
every single time the playbook executes. While it does replace
it afterwards it does not fire a notifier to make the service
restart, resulting in the service failing.

This patch makes the install process idempotent - it will only
wipe out the directory if it does not look the way it is
expected to look. It also fires the notifier to restart services
if the git repo changes.

This should ensure that novnc/spice restart properly on upgrades
and that there are no changes/restarts for the service if the git
SHA or software does not change.

Backport note:
The 'Manage LB' handler notification is removed as it is not
present in ocata.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/540437
Closes-Bug: #1746523
Change-Id: Ic39f884016a6ba0498110267027783001a087a1c
(cherry picked from commit c41103ba702cd6fd85d8e4d4fe86caef81623f44)

subject: Add a delay before the cell discovery
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-02-16 15:15:28.000000000', 'files': ['handlers/main.yml'], 'message': "Add a delay before the cell discovery

We're seeing a race condition during the upgrade test
for the role which causes the test to fail due to the
compute host not being proerly registered somehow. This
patch introduces a little bit of extra time between the
compute host being available and the cell discovery
executing which seems to help.

The extra delay is *only* executed in the role test
where the nova_discover_hosts_in_cells_interval is set
to -1. In a normal production environment it has no
effect.

Change-Id: Ice9deb82f052075f3b8a6ed1bc2387aac365d1fd
"}]
commit_message:
Add a delay before the cell discovery

We're seeing a race condition during the upgrade test
for the role which causes the test to fail due to the
compute host not being proerly registered somehow. This
patch introduces a little bit of extra time between the
compute host being available and the cell discovery
executing which seems to help.

The extra delay is *only* executed in the role test
where the nova_discover_hosts_in_cells_interval is set
to -1. In a normal production environment it has no
effect.

Change-Id: Ice9deb82f052075f3b8a6ed1bc2387aac365d1fd

The log directory for neutron has the default_t SELinux context and this
prevents rsyslog from accessing neutron's logs. This patch ensures that

This change also makes neutron's log directory configurable using the

Closes-Bug: 1748968

commit_message:
Add SELinux contexts for neutron log directory

The log directory for neutron has the default_t SELinux context and this
prevents rsyslog from accessing neutron's logs. This patch ensures that
the file contexts are set properly for neutron's logs.

This change also makes neutron's log directory configurable using the
`neutron_log_dir` variable.

Closes-Bug: 1748968
Change-Id: Ifbcca131435c8963cc9c1b85c000cc040fab27ab

With the latest ops changes, we use the clouds.yaml

previous branch is now queens, not pike.

Change-Id: I0c1d6298cd394426b6e4acbc1859c901fdd80439

commit_message:
Fix neutron upgrades

With the latest ops changes, we use the clouds.yaml
file for API testing.

We therefore need to generate it on localhost, where the
API tests are located.

On top of this, the scripts are modified to consider that
previous branch is now queens, not pike.

Change-Id: I0c1d6298cd394426b6e4acbc1859c901fdd80439
Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>

commit_message:
api-ref: note that force detach is admin-only by default

I had to dig into the code to figure out that the force
detach volume action was for admins by default. We should
make that clear in the API reference.

Change-Id: I3493e23dba8267fb7e403d30dd0d1e90c8f7726b

commit_message:
Cleanup role

This patch changes include: to include_tasks: to avoid warnings
in Ansible 2.4+. It also removes systemd conditionals since all
supported distributions have systemd.

Change-Id: Ic13886e8861d9fa00246eb849e6681d297291d2f

subject: Gracefully handle missing metadata in libvirt xml
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-16 14:01:55.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/compute/discovery.py'], 'message': 'Gracefully handle missing metadata in libvirt xml

Missing metadata in the libvirt domain xml for a nova instance would
cause ceilometer-compute to abort, leading to missing metrics for the
current and any subequent libvirt guests.

This commit puts a try/except AttributeError block around all the code
that is fetching attributes on the result of metadata_xml.find(...).

Change-Id: I8adc609cc21c86de2daba326d24b73a80d6eb61f
Closes-Bug: #1749960
'}]
commit_message:
Gracefully handle missing metadata in libvirt xml

Missing metadata in the libvirt domain xml for a nova instance would
cause ceilometer-compute to abort, leading to missing metrics for the
current and any subequent libvirt guests.

This commit puts a try/except AttributeError block around all the code
that is fetching attributes on the result of metadata_xml.find(...).

Change-Id: I8adc609cc21c86de2daba326d24b73a80d6eb61f
Closes-Bug: #1749960

commit_message:
Cleaned up minimal role, deprecated provisioning cookbook

- The minimal role contains a subset of allinone for use in integration. This
  allows to execute Tempest at the end of the Chef run.
- Being that chef-provisioning-vagrant is no longer working as of ChefDK 2.x,
  the provisioning cookbook serves no functional purpose.

Change-Id: I99a6de49640356c98adadf3237dc68383be06bb4
Implements: blueprint modern-chef
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/542612
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/542613

commit_message:
Add basic functional testing for swift3

This commit adds the following swift3 functional testing:

 1. Install and configure `s3cmd` utility
 2. Verify bucket creation
 3. Verify object upload
 4. Verify object listing
 5. Verify object and bucket deletion

Change-Id: I6290e8b02004f6c518983700a6439d28fbd127a4
Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>
(cherry picked from commit ea0d7bdb3e9a72d0c4d321a268227c84ddc9b270)

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-02-15 09:30:25.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'tox: stop validating locale files

They are autogenerated, and the updates are submitted automatically.
There is no much value in validating them. Also the recent translation
update https://review.openstack.org/#/c/542609/ removes the last pot
file and this validation starts failing.

Change-Id: I08a5c6acf4312df307aee4ba66f3d957191c8708
'}]
commit_message:
tox: stop validating locale files

They are autogenerated, and the updates are submitted automatically.
There is no much value in validating them. Also the recent translation
update https://review.openstack.org/#/c/542609/ removes the last pot
file and this validation starts failing.

Change-Id: I08a5c6acf4312df307aee4ba66f3d957191c8708

subject: Update init to work when inheriting from `overcloud deploy`
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-13 12:15:13.000000000', 'files': ['templates/overcloud_update_setup.sh.j2'], 'message': 'Update init to work when inheriting from `overcloud deploy`

The `overcloud update stack --init-update` command will inherit from
`overcloud deploy` [1], and as such it needs `--templates` parameter.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/540798/

Change-Id: Ifd047eab8326e913919b5b8911e10d93cba4f3a9
'}]
commit_message:
Update init to work when inheriting from `overcloud deploy`

The `overcloud update stack --init-update` command will inherit from
`overcloud deploy` [1], and as such it needs `--templates` parameter.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/540798/

Change-Id: Ifd047eab8326e913919b5b8911e10d93cba4f3a9

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Switch swift API tests to mock

This patch changes mox to mock for the following test modules:
* openstack_dashboard/test/unit/api/test_swift.py

commit_message:
Lay out a clouds.yaml file before upgrading

Upgrades use the clouds.yaml instead of environment variables
to test APIs. Swift doesn't have openstack_openrc in meta, and
no role that applies to localhost in the whole functional test
path has it. So we have to include openstack_openrc role.

Change-Id: I5196ab338659c65a6a3b7ac03095bbfb1e26c0a8
(cherry picked from commit 7ab62ddbea8c1bc3f350bd1319097240813ca476)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-16 10:58:13.000000000', 'files': ['virtualpdu/tests/unit/test_snmp_client.py', 'virtualpdu/tests/unit/test_pysnmp_handler.py', 'virtualpdu/tests/integration/pdu/test_pdu.py'], 'message': "fix uninitialized ASN.1 objects use

The underlying pyasn1 library has a notion of `schema` and
`value` object. The `schema` object can't be used with
regular Python operators as values because `schema` does
not carry any value, it's rather a type.

This fix turns a couple of `NoSuchInstance` schema
objects into proper `value` objects to retain compatibility
with the latest pysnmp which removed the default initializer
of the `NoSuchInstance` object.

Change-Id: Id044a0e437724bf1f3581e9187e2a1e6c336b1bc
"}]
commit_message:
fix uninitialized ASN.1 objects use

The underlying pyasn1 library has a notion of `schema` and
`value` object. The `schema` object can't be used with
regular Python operators as values because `schema` does
not carry any value, it's rather a type.

This fix turns a couple of `NoSuchInstance` schema
objects into proper `value` objects to retain compatibility
with the latest pysnmp which removed the default initializer
of the `NoSuchInstance` object.

Change-Id: Id044a0e437724bf1f3581e9187e2a1e6c336b1bc

subject: Replace virtualenv-tools by a script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-16 14:42:47.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/trove_install.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: Iad3a44f35c57d92dcbbfde4acbd86a3a4eb1879d
Partial-Bug: #1741634
(cherry picked from commit 2b51da5f0a3a1c088c5e8c27a2907e781ac6a131)
"}]
commit_message:
Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: Iad3a44f35c57d92dcbbfde4acbd86a3a4eb1879d
Partial-Bug: #1741634
(cherry picked from commit 2b51da5f0a3a1c088c5e8c27a2907e781ac6a131)

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2018-02-15 12:26:36.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_update.py'], 'message': "Adds --all-playbooks option to overcloud upgrade to run all playbooks

This adds the --all-playbooks option to the UpgradeOvercloud subclass.
Since we are subclassing, during major upgrade the operator must
specify the playbook to execute, otherwise the default
update_steps_playbook.yaml is used (which is wrong as that is for
minor update).

If this is an upgrade and the operator didn't specify at least one
of --all-playbooks or --playbook then sys.exit(1).

If --all-playbooks is passed then run upgrade, then deploy then
post_upgrade steps playbooks in sequence.

Change-Id: Ifdc727d7e71a95d4e211968e0b661b3646ff6aa3
"}]
commit_message:
Adds --all-playbooks option to overcloud upgrade to run all playbooks

This adds the --all-playbooks option to the UpgradeOvercloud subclass.
Since we are subclassing, during major upgrade the operator must
specify the playbook to execute, otherwise the default
update_steps_playbook.yaml is used (which is wrong as that is for
minor update).

If this is an upgrade and the operator didn't specify at least one
of --all-playbooks or --playbook then sys.exit(1).

If --all-playbooks is passed then run upgrade, then deploy then
post_upgrade steps playbooks in sequence.

Change-Id: Ifdc727d7e71a95d4e211968e0b661b3646ff6aa3

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-02-16 11:47:01.000000000', 'files': ['tests/roles/bootstrap-host/templates/user_variables.aio.yml.j2', 'ansible-role-requirements.yml'], 'message': 'Fix LXC volume size

With the change to allow volumes to dynamically grow we need to define
the default volume size to contain a valid size modifier. At present the
value is creating a sparse file that is 1024 bytes. This change sets the
size to gigabytes.

The role pin is updated to include the changes in the lxc_hosts role
which use this method of configuration. Without it the quota setting
end up with a GG at the end, which is invalid and the command fails.

Change-Id: Ib9b23b023d2ad03ce72c4abce5dc9e51d4643ac0
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix LXC volume size

With the change to allow volumes to dynamically grow we need to define
the default volume size to contain a valid size modifier. At present the
value is creating a sparse file that is 1024 bytes. This change sets the
size to gigabytes.

The role pin is updated to include the changes in the lxc_hosts role
which use this method of configuration. Without it the quota setting
end up with a GG at the end, which is invalid and the command fails.

Change-Id: Ib9b23b023d2ad03ce72c4abce5dc9e51d4643ac0
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Fix ARA/log data collection and reporting
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2018-02-15 19:51:51.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/scripts-library.sh', 'scripts/test-log-collect.sh', 'zuul.d/playbooks/post.yml'], 'message': 'Fix ARA/log data collection and reporting

Currently the ARA database is not collected after each
test, nor is the reporting done as it should be. This
patch does the following to resolve that:

1. Informs the log collection to collect to and from
   the right source folder.

2. Verifies that the logs directory exists to ensure
   that a missing directory does not cause the job to
   fail.

3. Makes the log collection quiet, so that only errors
   are reported when pulling them back to the zuul
   executor.

4. Removes a layer of indirection by making zuul use
   the scripts library directly instead of working
   through yet another wrapper script.

5. Sets the exit code properly so that the ARA report
   is run on test execution failure.

Change-Id: Ie8da165a33180d03c840a69dae0aa5f424a69e50
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ARA/log data collection and reporting

Currently the ARA database is not collected after each
test, nor is the reporting done as it should be. This
patch does the following to resolve that:

1. Informs the log collection to collect to and from
   the right source folder.

2. Verifies that the logs directory exists to ensure
   that a missing directory does not cause the job to
   fail.

3. Makes the log collection quiet, so that only errors
   are reported when pulling them back to the zuul
   executor.

4. Removes a layer of indirection by making zuul use
   the scripts library directly instead of working
   through yet another wrapper script.

5. Sets the exit code properly so that the ARA report
   is run on test execution failure.

Change-Id: Ie8da165a33180d03c840a69dae0aa5f424a69e50

subject: Update os_magnum role pin
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-16 11:20:43.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/kubernetes-pin-56768037d47ebc73.yaml', 'ansible-role-requirements.yml'], 'message': 'Update os_magnum role pin

The magnum source repository unfortunately is not
adhering to the global requirements management process
in that it has requirements specified in the repo which
are not in the global requirements repo.

As a result of the requirement being missing, those
requirements are not constrained by upper-constraints.
That, in turn, causes the repo build to fail to build
the magnum venv due to incompatible requirements.

This patch brings in the updated role SHA which pins
kubernetes and related dependencies and the release note
to communicate the change.

Change-Id: I49312a568ff6ce74497f00eec288166707e33fc0
'}]
commit_message:
Update os_magnum role pin

The magnum source repository unfortunately is not
adhering to the global requirements management process
in that it has requirements specified in the repo which
are not in the global requirements repo.

As a result of the requirement being missing, those
requirements are not constrained by upper-constraints.
That, in turn, causes the repo build to fail to build
the magnum venv due to incompatible requirements.

This patch brings in the updated role SHA which pins
kubernetes and related dependencies and the release note
to communicate the change.

Change-Id: I49312a568ff6ce74497f00eec288166707e33fc0

subject: Reduce scope: do not merge misplaced objects into container listing
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-02-16 11:50:13.000000000', 'files': ['swift/container/server.py', 'test/unit/container/test_server.py'], 'message': "Reduce scope: do not merge misplaced objects into container listing

Before, while a container was sharding, any misplaced objects
(i.e. updates received since sharding started, for ranges not yet
found) would be merged with the listing from the retired db in an
attempt to give the most up to date listing. However, the merging code
was flawed as it did not respect the data, content-type and metadata
timestamps when merging, but erroneously assumed that all misplaced
objects were newer than those in the retired db.

This patch removes the flawed merge code and consequently listings of
as yet uncleaved ranges will not include recently received updates
that are in the misplaced objects table.

Misplaced objects will be included when cleaving a shard range and will
then appear in the concatenated listing that is constructed by the
proxy server.

Also removes an 'expectedFailure' unit test that covered merging
lists from two dbs.

Change-Id: If58a2e943ccca2e6898dce7c9a2883e870d9cdbb
"}]
commit_message:
Reduce scope: do not merge misplaced objects into container listing

Before, while a container was sharding, any misplaced objects
(i.e. updates received since sharding started, for ranges not yet
found) would be merged with the listing from the retired db in an
attempt to give the most up to date listing. However, the merging code
was flawed as it did not respect the data, content-type and metadata
timestamps when merging, but erroneously assumed that all misplaced
objects were newer than those in the retired db.

This patch removes the flawed merge code and consequently listings of
as yet uncleaved ranges will not include recently received updates
that are in the misplaced objects table.

Misplaced objects will be included when cleaving a shard range and will
then appear in the concatenated listing that is constructed by the
proxy server.

Also removes an 'expectedFailure' unit test that covered merging
lists from two dbs.

Change-Id: If58a2e943ccca2e6898dce7c9a2883e870d9cdbb

subject: Don't load nested stack to get ResourceGroup blacklist
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-01-19 20:42:54.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/software_deployment.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/resource_group.py', 'heat/tests/openstack/heat/test_resource_group.py'], 'message': "Don't load nested stack to get ResourceGroup blacklist

In ResourceGroup, we (unwisely in retrospect) allow blacklisting of
resources by reference ID (i.e. physical resource ID in most cases). In
order to both determine whether a removal policy entry was an existing
resource name and (if not) to find the resource by physical ID, we would
always load the nested stack into memory.

To avoid this, unconditionally create an output in the nested stack that
returns a mapping of all the resource reference IDs and use it for finding
a resource with a matching reference ID. Only if the output is not
available (because the nested stack hasn't been updated since prior to the
output being defined), fall back to the old way of doing it.

Avoid looking up IDs for names that already appear in the blacklist
(because they were blacklisted in a previous update and have been removed
from the stack.)

Since this is more expensive in time (though hopefully cheaper in space),
update the blacklist only once on resource creation and whenever it
actually changes during an update. This is accomplished by moving the
update to a separate function that is called explicitly, rather than making
it a side-effect of getting the current blacklist (which occurs up to 4
times in each create/update).

Change-Id: Ic32d7d99bad06f92b3d2919d58cd1f9128bcfe83
Partial-Bug: #1731349
"}]
commit_message:
Don't load nested stack to get ResourceGroup blacklist

In ResourceGroup, we (unwisely in retrospect) allow blacklisting of
resources by reference ID (i.e. physical resource ID in most cases). In
order to both determine whether a removal policy entry was an existing
resource name and (if not) to find the resource by physical ID, we would
always load the nested stack into memory.

To avoid this, unconditionally create an output in the nested stack that
returns a mapping of all the resource reference IDs and use it for finding
a resource with a matching reference ID. Only if the output is not
available (because the nested stack hasn't been updated since prior to the
output being defined), fall back to the old way of doing it.

Avoid looking up IDs for names that already appear in the blacklist
(because they were blacklisted in a previous update and have been removed
from the stack.)

Since this is more expensive in time (though hopefully cheaper in space),
update the blacklist only once on resource creation and whenever it
actually changes during an update. This is accomplished by moving the
update to a separate function that is called explicitly, rather than making
it a side-effect of getting the current blacklist (which occurs up to 4
times in each create/update).

Change-Id: Ic32d7d99bad06f92b3d2919d58cd1f9128bcfe83
Partial-Bug: #1731349

api-ref: provide more detail on what a provider aggregate is

The description of placement resource provider aggregates is mostly
discussing how they aren't nova's concept of host aggregates, but
doesn't give a very simple description of what they are.

This provides a simple description and the canonical example of a
shared storage pool.

subject: Join cluster without using a failed task
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2018-02-10 17:08:51.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/rabbitmq_cluster.yml', 'tasks/rabbitmq_cluster_join.yml'], 'message': "Join cluster without using a failed task

Currently a new node joining the cluster is done by using
a try/rescue operation which always fails for a new node,
causing a lot of confusion due to the failed task report.

This patch ensures that the implementation no longer does
that.

In order to prevent lint check failures, each join task
has a 'changed_when: true' added.

Change-Id: Ic1da9f3ad1016831fe37643165880e7ff98ca923
"}]
commit_message:
Join cluster without using a failed task

Currently a new node joining the cluster is done by using
a try/rescue operation which always fails for a new node,
causing a lot of confusion due to the failed task report.

This patch ensures that the implementation no longer does
that.

In order to prevent lint check failures, each join task
has a 'changed_when: true' added.

Change-Id: Ic1da9f3ad1016831fe37643165880e7ff98ca923

subject: Set pip to use the pypi-server when locked down
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2018-02-10 17:13:43.000000000', 'files': ['templates/pip.conf.j2', 'tasks/configure.yml'], 'message': 'Set pip to use the pypi-server when locked down

The repo server now hosts a native pypi-server. This new server allows
us to use a native pip install instead of our existing "find-links"
approach. Moving to the native pypi server is not only faster, it is also
more scalable. This change agments our existing wheel lockdown by
setting the index to our new pypi-server and defining an online
constraint file in the pip.conf.

Additional checks have been set within the configuration task file so
that we're confirming pip can be locked down prior to setting the
pip.conf file which can, and will break a deployment if configured
incorrectly. These tasks will only fire when the option
`pip_lock_to_internal_repo` has been set to "true" making them a no-op
by default.

Change-Id: I2f9aaa1aecf7d03a833f60d483de364d6a6d64fa
Depends-On: Icc2ee264fc213b258642b5393dd78b1b26ef0542
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Set pip to use the pypi-server when locked down

The repo server now hosts a native pypi-server. This new server allows
us to use a native pip install instead of our existing "find-links"
approach. Moving to the native pypi server is not only faster, it is also
more scalable. This change agments our existing wheel lockdown by
setting the index to our new pypi-server and defining an online
constraint file in the pip.conf.

Additional checks have been set within the configuration task file so
that we're confirming pip can be locked down prior to setting the
pip.conf file which can, and will break a deployment if configured
incorrectly. These tasks will only fire when the option
`pip_lock_to_internal_repo` has been set to "true" making them a no-op
by default.

Change-Id: I2f9aaa1aecf7d03a833f60d483de364d6a6d64fa
Depends-On: Icc2ee264fc213b258642b5393dd78b1b26ef0542
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Replace virtualenv-tools by a script
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-02-07 19:42:13.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/trove_install.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: Iad3a44f35c57d92dcbbfde4acbd86a3a4eb1879d
Partial-Bug: #1741634
"}]
commit_message:
Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: Iad3a44f35c57d92dcbbfde4acbd86a3a4eb1879d
Partial-Bug: #1741634

commit_message:
Stop running non-voting jobs in gate

There isn't a need to run non-voting jobs in gate, as it ends up just
wasting CI resources.  Results can be obtained from the check pipeline
results.

Change-Id: Ic09301ca37d497c3400dd9678cf754c71510410a
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add basic functional testing for swift3

This commit adds the following swift3 functional testing:

 1. Install and configure `s3cmd` utility
 2. Verify bucket creation
 3. Verify object upload
 4. Verify object listing
 5. Verify object and bucket deletion

Change-Id: I6290e8b02004f6c518983700a6439d28fbd127a4
Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>

subject: Lay out a clouds.yaml file before upgrading
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-02-16 09:06:05.000000000', 'files': ['tests/ansible-role-requirements.yml', 'tests/test-swift-resources-upgrade.yml'], 'message': "Lay out a clouds.yaml file before upgrading

Upgrades use the clouds.yaml instead of environment variables
to test APIs. Swift doesn't have openstack_openrc in meta, and
no role that applies to localhost in the whole functional test
path has it. So we have to include openstack_openrc role.

Change-Id: I5196ab338659c65a6a3b7ac03095bbfb1e26c0a8
"}]
commit_message:
Lay out a clouds.yaml file before upgrading

Upgrades use the clouds.yaml instead of environment variables
to test APIs. Swift doesn't have openstack_openrc in meta, and
no role that applies to localhost in the whole functional test
path has it. So we have to include openstack_openrc role.

Change-Id: I5196ab338659c65a6a3b7ac03095bbfb1e26c0a8

commit_message:
Add release notes

We've enabled the release notes zuul job quite late in the release
cycle, for which reason some of the notes are missing, being added
by this change.

This change also adds a reference to the release notes page on
the main compute-hyperv docs page.

Change-Id: If5c717bad101b55379201a02afe6f88b3cd9345d

commit_message:
Set proper yum repo priority on CentOS 7

This patch ensures that we get galera from the MariaDB repos
and not from RDO. This matches I2c8e4e64c2425cd36903ae9288bd9fee29eef355
which did the same thing for the galera-server role.

Closes-Bug: #1739472
Change-Id: I8f22083a306ba7569148a53af94397c31d90dbac

subject: Show errors when copying logs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-16 09:54:58.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/playbooks/post.yml'], 'message': 'Show errors when copying logs

In https://review.openstack.org/544998 the logging of the
files copied was removed from logging altogether. In this
patch we achieve the goal of not showing all the files
copied, but we still show errors which is more informative
without wasting log lines.

Change-Id: Iffe4baad65d1d2a1812e62f78d54441ae8dbaff2
'}]
commit_message:
Show errors when copying logs

In https://review.openstack.org/544998 the logging of the
files copied was removed from logging altogether. In this
patch we achieve the goal of not showing all the files
copied, but we still show errors which is more informative
without wasting log lines.

Change-Id: Iffe4baad65d1d2a1812e62f78d54441ae8dbaff2

commit_message:
Set correct group membership of /var/log/mysql_logs directory

This patch sets group membership to `adm`.
It makes Galera log files accessible for rsyslog daemon.

Closes-Bug: #1745442

subject: Generate a unique machine-id
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-02-14 16:11:06.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/lxc_container_create.yml'], 'message': 'Generate a unique machine-id

The systemd machine-id needs to be unique on all network attached
devices. This change ensures that when a container comes online, a
unique machine-id is generated if one was not already present. When
the machine-id is created for the first time the container will restart
so the new ID can take effect.

More information on the machine-id can be found here:
https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/machine-id.html

Change-Id: Ib25aeeecf1e6001e6c6b1a7d6b6d50eca7ab45fa
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Generate a unique machine-id

The systemd machine-id needs to be unique on all network attached
devices. This change ensures that when a container comes online, a
unique machine-id is generated if one was not already present. When
the machine-id is created for the first time the container will restart
so the new ID can take effect.

More information on the machine-id can be found here:
https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/machine-id.html

Change-Id: Ib25aeeecf1e6001e6c6b1a7d6b6d50eca7ab45fa
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Install only the required storage driver extras
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-02-11 17:30:54.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Install only the required storage driver extras

At the moment, all drivers are being installed for Gnocchi even
if some of them are not used.  This also means that some libraries
are being built which are not needed (such as for Ceph or Swift
when using file storage).

This patch switches the behaviour to install only the extra for
the driver in use.

Change-Id: I6e9f938885036d2fabc81094e01e220b09e462dd
'}]
commit_message:
Install only the required storage driver extras

At the moment, all drivers are being installed for Gnocchi even
if some of them are not used.  This also means that some libraries
are being built which are not needed (such as for Ceph or Swift
when using file storage).

This patch switches the behaviour to install only the extra for
the driver in use.

Change-Id: I6e9f938885036d2fabc81094e01e220b09e462dd

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-14 16:05:56.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Remove pycrypto from requirements.txt

We stopped using pycrypto for secrets generation a while back

Change-Id: I7cfce70bbf630d1cf15fcc358bdba3371c03ceee

commit_message:
Remove pycrypto from requirements.txt

We stopped using pycrypto for secrets generation a while back
but the requirement remained in requirements.txt. This patch
removes it.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 11076, 'name': 'Shivanand Tendulker', 'email': 'stendulker@gmail.com', 'username': 'stendulker'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 11878, 'name': 'Rushil Chugh', 'email': 'rushil.chugh@gmail.com', 'username': 'rushil'}, {'_account_id': 12356, 'name': 'Vladyslav Drok', 'email': 'vdrok@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vdrok'}, {'_account_id': 14629, 'name': 'HPE Proliant', 'email': 'proliantutils@gmail.com', 'username': 'proliantci'}, {'_account_id': 19003, 'name': 'Fujitsu iRMC CI', 'email': 'fj-lsoft-irmcci@dl.jp.fujitsu.com', 'username': 'Fujitsu_iRMC_CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 19339, 'name': 'Dell EMC Ironic CI', 'email': 'openstack-ironic-ci@dell.com', 'username': 'openstack-ironic-ci'}, {'_account_id': 24828, 'name': 'Kaifeng Wang', 'email': 'kaifeng.w@gmail.com', 'username': 'wangkf'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-04-17 12:06:51.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_ssh.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/ssh.py'], 'message': 'Fix for ssh provisioning of VirtualBox VMs

This fix addresses the limitation in VirtualBox that you cannot
set the boot device while the node is powered on. Provisioning
of VirtualBox VMs with the pxe_ssh driver will fail because it
attempts to the set the boot device prior to booting the
tenant image.

This fix will detect whether the VirtualBox node is powered on,
and if so will store the target boot device for later
application when the node is next powered on.

There is existing logic controlled by the use_headless option
that addresses this behavior by powering off the node as part of
setting the boot device; however, this approach interferes with
the overall deployment workflow. I have kept this behavior in
place for backward compatibility, but when use_headless is not
set the new logic that stores the boot device is used.

Change-Id: Id0f1db0eea520eeae40af11a924bf8174ff2920c
Closes-Bug: #1682814
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for ssh provisioning of VirtualBox VMs

This fix addresses the limitation in VirtualBox that you cannot
set the boot device while the node is powered on. Provisioning
of VirtualBox VMs with the pxe_ssh driver will fail because it
attempts to the set the boot device prior to booting the
tenant image.

This fix will detect whether the VirtualBox node is powered on,
and if so will store the target boot device for later
application when the node is next powered on.

There is existing logic controlled by the use_headless option
that addresses this behavior by powering off the node as part of
setting the boot device; however, this approach interferes with
the overall deployment workflow. I have kept this behavior in
place for backward compatibility, but when use_headless is not
set the new logic that stores the boot device is used.

Change-Id: Id0f1db0eea520eeae40af11a924bf8174ff2920c
Closes-Bug: #1682814

subject: Get Instance/AutoScalingGroup attributes from nested stack outputs
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-01-19 20:42:54.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/autoscaling/test_heat_scaling_group.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/instance_group.py', 'heat/tests/openstack/heat/test_instance_group.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/autoscaling_group.py'], 'message': "Get Instance/AutoScalingGroup attributes from nested stack outputs

Since Pike we've generated the templates for various nested stack resource
types with outputs that produce the attribute values that are referenced in
the parent stack, and a previous patch did the same for resource IDs. Use
these output values when available to calculate the attribute values. This
is efficient, because the all of the outputs are fetched together and
cached, and avoids using the grouputils functions that cause the nested
stack to get loaded into memory in the same process.

Fall back to the existing implementation (using grouputils) if the required
output isn't available (generally this would be due to the nested stack
being created on an earlier version of Heat that did not include the
outputs in the generated template, and not updated since).

The InstanceGroup and AutoScalingGroup implementations are more complex
than those of ResourceGroup and ResourceChain because they exclude failed
resources at runtime, and also must have a stable sort order for list-type
outputs that cannot be determined at template generation time. Therefore
the underlying output value is always a dict, and the attribute value is
calculated from it.

Change-Id: Ie4ad85068fdc16b8038a09df709ed7eb86434cfa
Partial-Bug: #1731349
"}]
commit_message:
Get Instance/AutoScalingGroup attributes from nested stack outputs

Since Pike we've generated the templates for various nested stack resource
types with outputs that produce the attribute values that are referenced in
the parent stack, and a previous patch did the same for resource IDs. Use
these output values when available to calculate the attribute values. This
is efficient, because the all of the outputs are fetched together and
cached, and avoids using the grouputils functions that cause the nested
stack to get loaded into memory in the same process.

Fall back to the existing implementation (using grouputils) if the required
output isn't available (generally this would be due to the nested stack
being created on an earlier version of Heat that did not include the
outputs in the generated template, and not updated since).

The InstanceGroup and AutoScalingGroup implementations are more complex
than those of ResourceGroup and ResourceChain because they exclude failed
resources at runtime, and also must have a stable sort order for list-type
outputs that cannot be determined at template generation time. Therefore
the underlying output value is always a dict, and the attribute value is
calculated from it.

Change-Id: Ie4ad85068fdc16b8038a09df709ed7eb86434cfa
Partial-Bug: #1731349

commit_message:
Provide a way to disable mox completely

This commit introduces 'use_mox' attribute to TestCase class.
If this is set to False, TestCase does not setup mox.

In addition, a common method to emit the deprecation warning
was introduced in APITestCase.

Part of blueprint mock-framework-in-unit-tests
Change-Id: I1e3df7ea2a867b8a7aa69523bed2beaab9663dc0

commit_message:
tempest: remove now-useless workarounds for unreliable tests

Some workarounds/tuning where in place to accomodate
with stale ARP entries for gateway IP addresses dut to
bug 1748234 in reference driver.

Now that this bug is fixed, this change removes these
workarounds.

Related-Bug: 1748234

subject: Properly constrain magnum dependencies
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-02-15 18:56:21.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/kubernetes-pin-56768037d47ebc73.yaml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Properly constrain magnum dependencies

The magnum source repository unfortunately is not
adhering to the global requirements management process
in that it has requirements specified in the repo which
are not in the global requirements repo.

As a result of the requirement being missing, those
requirements are not constrained by upper-constraints.
That, in turn, causes the repo build to fail to build
the magnum venv due to incompatible requirements.

Given that Ocata is a bit old and we're unlikely to be
able to change the project's behaviour, we implement
our own pins in the repo for the extra dependencies
(both direct and indirect).

The pins we set here are based on the upper-constraints
for pike which do no conflict with the rest of the ocata
libraries.

Change-Id: I987cfd2f1fa2be967c4cd86a00f9071915e25973
"}]
commit_message:
Properly constrain magnum dependencies

The magnum source repository unfortunately is not
adhering to the global requirements management process
in that it has requirements specified in the repo which
are not in the global requirements repo.

As a result of the requirement being missing, those
requirements are not constrained by upper-constraints.
That, in turn, causes the repo build to fail to build
the magnum venv due to incompatible requirements.

Given that Ocata is a bit old and we're unlikely to be
able to change the project's behaviour, we implement
our own pins in the repo for the extra dependencies
(both direct and indirect).

The pins we set here are based on the upper-constraints
for pike which do no conflict with the rest of the ocata
libraries.

Change-Id: I987cfd2f1fa2be967c4cd86a00f9071915e25973

subject: Set a fact for handling yum's fastestmirror plugin
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-15 17:22:23.000000000', 'files': ['common-tasks/test-set-nodepool-vars.yml'], 'message': "Set a fact for handling yum's fastestmirror plugin

In the past, we've messed around with enabling or disabling the
yum's fastestmirror plugin. It is helpful if you are running outside
the OpenStack CI system since it will find the fastest mirrors from
a publicly available mirror list.

However, in the CI system, we override the mirror list with a hard-
coded mirror in the `baseurl` line. There's no need to load or use
the fastestmirror plugin in these situations and gathering a list
of mirrors just slows things down.

This patch sets a fact that other roles can check and disable the
fastestmirror plugin when needed.

Change-Id: I8b2a1db084ab47962dbef8c6b037836f44b4ed46
(cherry picked from commit 63375381736f29a0265e06d3e4ae3408a73c8ec9)
"}]
commit_message:
Set a fact for handling yum's fastestmirror plugin

In the past, we've messed around with enabling or disabling the
yum's fastestmirror plugin. It is helpful if you are running outside
the OpenStack CI system since it will find the fastest mirrors from
a publicly available mirror list.

However, in the CI system, we override the mirror list with a hard-
coded mirror in the `baseurl` line. There's no need to load or use
the fastestmirror plugin in these situations and gathering a list
of mirrors just slows things down.

This patch sets a fact that other roles can check and disable the
fastestmirror plugin when needed.

Change-Id: I8b2a1db084ab47962dbef8c6b037836f44b4ed46
(cherry picked from commit 63375381736f29a0265e06d3e4ae3408a73c8ec9)

commit_message:
Further use of ordered dicts.

For consistent rendering of the haproxy template under Python 3,
ensure that ordered dictionaries are used so that dict iteration
always results in the same template output.

Change-Id: I119027810e7f7976c794ff7f34a902d256f8963d
Closes-Bug: 1737776

commit_message:
Fix monasca-ceilometer ceilometer.metering.storage config typo

When replacing the list of ceilometer.metering.storage entries to
add monasca, a typo caused the ceilometer.sample.publisher list
to be overwritten with the ceilometer.metering.storage list.

Change-Id: Icdf62bb7b4ba4552411361324098938aee3c5592

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-02-14 19:24:51.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_db.py'], 'message': 'Fixing the filter in get MTU by network list query.

Based on the observation that a call to sync_routers can be slow
(10-15 seconds for one virtual router), and that profiling data show
that a significant amount of time is spent in function
_get_mtus_by_network_list, this change fixes incorrect the database
query for getting information about networks.

What changed:
- before: SQL query spent time O(#networks in database)
          (select all exists networks from database)
- after : SQL query spent time O(#network_ids passed to the function)
          (select only needed networks)

A basic test shows a drastic improvements, from 2 second to around
~0.2 second, in the processing of a _get_mtus_by_network_list call
with 300 networks in database.

Change-Id: Id50d1aaddd0d2a1110502de9c5b974063daa296a
Closes-Bug: #1748888
'}]
commit_message:
Fixing the filter in get MTU by network list query.

Based on the observation that a call to sync_routers can be slow
(10-15 seconds for one virtual router), and that profiling data show
that a significant amount of time is spent in function
_get_mtus_by_network_list, this change fixes incorrect the database
query for getting information about networks.

What changed:
- before: SQL query spent time O(#networks in database)
          (select all exists networks from database)
- after : SQL query spent time O(#network_ids passed to the function)
          (select only needed networks)

A basic test shows a drastic improvements, from 2 second to around
~0.2 second, in the processing of a _get_mtus_by_network_list call
with 300 networks in database.

Change-Id: Id50d1aaddd0d2a1110502de9c5b974063daa296a
Closes-Bug: #1748888

commit_message:
py3: port common/ring/ and common/utils.py

I can't imagine us *not* having a py3 proxy server at some point, and
that proxy server is going to need a ring.

While we're at it (and since they were so close anyway), port

* cli/ringbuilder.py and
* common/linkat.py
* common/daemon.py

Change-Id: Iec8d97e0ce925614a86b516c4c6ed82809d0ba9b

commit_message:
Team diversity tags update, February 2018

* Congress no longer has diverse affiliation, due to only
  two core reviewers being active.

* Cyborg no longer has diverse affiliation, 88% of core reviews
  coming from Lenovo and Huawei.

* EC2API no longer is single-vendor, as its main developer is
  now independent.

* Glance no longer has diverse affiliation, 85% of core reviews
  coming from Red Hat and Verizon (55% for Red Hat alone).

* Masakari is single-vendor, with NTT doing 98% of core reviews.

* Monasca now has diverse affiliation, thanks to an increase in
  participation from HPE, OP5 and SUSE.

* Murano no longer has diverse affiliation, with 98% of core
  reviews coming from ZTE and AT&T.

* Qinling is single-vendor, with CatalystIT holding all core
  reviews.

* Senlin now has diverse affiliation, thanks to increased
  participation from AWCloud and Blizzard Entertainment.

* Solum is now single-vendor, with ZTE doing all core reviews.

* Storlets is now single-vendor, with NTT doing all core reviews.

* Tacker no longer has diverse affiliation, with 84% of core
  reviews coming from 99Cloud and NEC (64% from 99Cloud alone).

* Trove no longer is single-vendor, with increased participation
  from IBM, China Mobile, AWCloud and OVH.

Change-Id: I380b205e6958b4e042a435649f557be629ade06e

commit_message:
Change pool manager cache driver

This patchset changes the default pool manager cache driver used by
the designate charm from "memcached" to "sqlalchemy".

Change-Id: If61a28f572137b0e3041d17bd9296929074faf7d
Closes-Bug: #1739012

subject: add support for ldaps and starttls via config opts
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2018-02-06 18:00:12.000000000', 'files': ['src/config.yaml', 'src/templates/keystone.conf', 'src/lib/charm/openstack/keystone_ldap.py', 'unit_tests/test_lib_charm_openstack_keystone_ldap.py'], 'message': 'add support for ldaps and starttls via config opts

* Both ldaps and ldap + StartTLS require a CA certificate configuration
option;
* use_tls option should only be used for StartTLS and will result in an
error if used with a URL that starts with ldaps;
* if a certificate is specified then LDAP backend server's certificate
validation is considered mandatory ("demand" option).

Depends-On: Ied4b6ed64354e3de3c78e6ac809666ee9ae29d1a
Change-Id: I659683ffec91560ebbd77969840c27e3d7048689
Closes-Bug: #1728155
'}]
commit_message:
add support for ldaps and starttls via config opts

* Both ldaps and ldap + StartTLS require a CA certificate configuration
option;
* use_tls option should only be used for StartTLS and will result in an
error if used with a URL that starts with ldaps;
* if a certificate is specified then LDAP backend server's certificate
validation is considered mandatory ("demand" option).

Depends-On: Ied4b6ed64354e3de3c78e6ac809666ee9ae29d1a
Change-Id: I659683ffec91560ebbd77969840c27e3d7048689
Closes-Bug: #1728155

Move legacy jobs to project

Move jobs to tap-as-a-servire repo

Backport note: I removed the project name.  See [2]

commit_message:
VGPU: Modify the example of vgpu white_list set

`enabled_vgpu_types` flag has been set in nova.conf to set enabled
vgpu type of current host. The example is wrong.
Modify the example to avoid mislead.

Change-Id: If7a150d4d28609cabeb5f513bbd134a969fca17c
Closes-Bug: #1746217
(cherry picked from commit 8e687ab4f85561e31e4da06d89e9505179abc127)

subject: Make bdms querying in multi-cell use scatter-gather and ignore down cell
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26297, 'name': 'pippo', 'email': '1211099771@qq.com', 'username': 'huang.zhiping'}, {'_account_id': 26515, 'name': 'Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'nova_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'nova_hyperv_ci'}, {'_account_id': 26936, 'name': 'Surya Seetharaman', 'email': 'suryaseetharaman.9@gmail.com', 'username': 'tssurya'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-12 15:24:55.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_extended_volumes.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/extended_volumes.py'], 'message': 'Make bdms querying in multi-cell use scatter-gather and ignore down cell

This patch makes the querying of bdms from multiple cells in the
_get_instance_bdms_in_multiple_cells function of extended_volumes use
scatter_gather_cells thus making the process, parallel. It also adds
warnings in case a cell is not available; which the operator can later
tweak, if an exception needs to be raised. So for now, cells that are
not reachable are ignored and it proceeds to the next cell.

Change-Id: I0e05eb1e2ad37962968b79100bf4a96c7d6ddd8f
Closes-Bug: #1747650
(cherry picked from commit ea6757092df85b6cce38980ae5b7f54b76657e01)
'}]
commit_message:
Make bdms querying in multi-cell use scatter-gather and ignore down cell

This patch makes the querying of bdms from multiple cells in the
_get_instance_bdms_in_multiple_cells function of extended_volumes use
scatter_gather_cells thus making the process, parallel. It also adds
warnings in case a cell is not available; which the operator can later
tweak, if an exception needs to be raised. So for now, cells that are
not reachable are ignored and it proceeds to the next cell.

Change-Id: I0e05eb1e2ad37962968b79100bf4a96c7d6ddd8f
Closes-Bug: #1747650
(cherry picked from commit ea6757092df85b6cce38980ae5b7f54b76657e01)
